name: Acne
question1: did your problem face  with acne begin more than two month?
question2: Do you have blackheads, whiteheads, pustules, or cysts?
question3: What products do you use? Do any of them help?
question4: Have you been developing extra body or facial hair?
test: Blood tests (liver function tests, cholesterol, or if you are female, perhaps a pregnancy test if you are taking the medicine Accutane)

name: AIDS
question2: Do you feel guilty in your neck region?

name: Alcoholic hepatitis
question1: Do you feel fever, fatigue, weekness?
question4: Do you take a lot of alcohol?
test: Liver function tests,An ultrasound, CT or MRI scan of the liver, Blood tests

name: Allergy
question1: Are your sneezing and runny nose the result of a common cold or a sign of allergies?
questions2: Are you tired and irritable? Your fatigue could be a sign of untreated allergies
question3: Have you rashes on your skin?
question4: You snore or have trouble staying asleep.

name: Arthritis
question1: Do you feel pain or stifness in your joints?
question2: Are you more than 40 years old?
question3: Do you feel uncomfortable standing after sitting a few moments at one place?
test: Hematocrit (HCT) and hemoglobin (Hgb) counts, White blood cell count (WBC),Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR)

name: Bronchial Asthma
question2: eeling very tired or weak when exercising?
question3: Do you feel Chest tightness, pain, or pressure?
test: X-ray or computerized tomography (CT) imaging of your ches,CT scans of your sinuses, Blood tests

name: Cervical spondylosis
question1: Do you feel a stiff neck?
question2: Do you feel headaches that mostly occur in the back of the head?
question3: Do you feel tingling or numbness that mainly affects the shoulders and arms, although it can also occur in the legs?
question4: Do you feel tilting your neck backward?
test: Flexion compression tes, Jackson compression test, Percussion test

name: Chicken pox
question1: Do you feel Raised pink or red bumps (papules), which break out over several days?
question2: Do you feel Crusts and scabs
question3: Do you feel hhe rash spreads to one or both eyes?
question4: Anyone in the household has a problem with his or her immune system or is younger than 6 months?

name: Chronic cholestasis
question1: Do you have The yellowing of your skin and the white of your eyes?
question2: do you feel pain in your abdomen
test: Tests for Liver Injury, Tests for Cholestasis,Liver Biopsy, Imaging Tests of the Liver and Gallbladder

name: common clod
question2: do you feel a Stuffy nose?
question3: Do you feel Trouble breathing or fast breathing?
test: Rapid influenza antigen tests, Molecular flu tests

name: Dengue
question2: Do you feel Aches and pains (eye pain, typically behind the eyes, muscle, joint, or bone pain)
question3: You have Bleeding from the nose or gums?
question4: Do you feel any warning sign?
test: Acetaminophen Level, Acid-Fast Bacillus (AFB) Tests, Adrenocorticotropic Hormone (ACTH), Albumin Blood Test

name: Diabetes
question3: Getting a lot of infections, such as gum, skin and vaginal infections
test: A1C Test ,Fasting Blood Sugar Test , Glucose Tolerance Test

name: Dimorphic hemmorhoids(piles)
question2: Pain or ache in your anus, especially when you sit.

name: Drug Reaction
question1: What drug do you suspect caused your reaction?
question2: When did you start taking it, and have you stopped taking it?
question3: How long did your symptoms last, and what did you do to relieve them?
question4: Do you consume herbal medications or take vitamin or mineral supplements? If so, which ones?

name: Fungal infection
question1: redness and soreness on and surrounding the vagina
question2: unusual vaginal discharge, such as gray clumps that resemble cottage cheese or a very watery discharge
question3: itching and swelling around the vagina
question4: burning sensations or pain during urination or intercourse
test: swab test, blood test, urine test

name: Gastroenteritis
question1: You have a fever above 104 F (40 C)
question2: You're not able to keep liquids down for 24 hours
question4: You've been vomiting or having diarrhea for more than two days

name: GERD
question1: Chest pain (severe chest pain could be something more serious than GERD and requires immediate medical help)
question2: Trouble swallowing or feeling like thereâ€™s a lump in the throat
question3: Dry cough or throat clearing repeatedly

name: Heartattack
question1: Chest pain that may feel like pressure, tightness, pain, squeezing or aching
question2: Do you feel Lightheadedness or sudden dizziness?
